"* The game can be played from a first-person OR third-person perspective, 
* marking it as the first boxing game to offer this unique viewpoint."

Yep. The first, as long as you don't count 4D Boxing. Which did 1st person, 3rd person, and, oddly enough, your opponents first person views. It also had a career mode, and the option to create your own fighter.

Mind you, it's ancient and low rez, with, maybe 50 polygons per fighter, and that's if you turn up the settings to max. And good luck trying to get it to run without DosBox. 

I spent hours playing that one, back in the early 90s.
